com.percussion.xmldom
Class PSXmlDomContext

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.xmldom.PSXmlDomContext

public class PSXmlDomContext
extends Object

This class provides centralized parameter passing, exception handling and trace message support for the xmldom package.

Constructor Summary

          create a context where an IPSRequestContext is not available.

Constructor Detail

PSXmlDomContext

public PSXmlDomContext(String functionName)
create a context where an IPSRequestContext is not available. This is primarily used when debugging.

PSXmlDomContext

public PSXmlDomContext(String functionName,
                       IPSRequestContext req)
create a context for the extension. The context should be a be a member variable of the Process method in each extension.

Method Detail

rxCommentHandling

public boolean rxCommentHandling()
Are comments handled rhythmyx specific or not?

Returns:
true if comments are handled rhythmyx specific, false otherwise.

setRxCommentHandling

public void setRxCommentHandling(boolean value)
Set whether comments are handled rhythmyx specific or not.

Parameters:
value - true to handle comments rhythmyx specific, false otherwise.

printTraceMessage

public void printTraceMessage(String msg)
Allows support routines to print trace messages without knowing about the IPSRequestContext

getServerRoot

public String getServerRoot()
Gets the server's root value from the request.

Returns:
server root string in the format: 127.0.0.1:<port_nr>/<rootname>

getTidyProperties

public Properties getTidyProperties()
get the tidy properties for this operation context

isTidyEnabled

public boolean isTidyEnabled()
determine if Tidy processing is enabled for this context

setServerPageTags

public void setServerPageTags(String filename)
Sets the Server page tags file name for this context

Parameters:
filename - the name of the server page tags file

getServerPageTags

public String getServerPageTags()
Gets the current ServerPageTags file name

Returns:
the name of the server page tags file, or null if one hasn't been assigned

isServerPageTags

public boolean isServerPageTags()
get the state of serverPageTags.

Returns:
true if a ServerPageTags.xml file has been defined

setLogging

public void setLogging(boolean logFlag)
set the state of the logging flag

Parameters:
logFlag - a boolean determining if logging is set. The logging flag will be automatically enabled by the constructor if the IPSRequestContext.isTraceEnabled method returns true

isLogging

public boolean isLogging()
read the logging flag

Returns:
true if logging is enabled; false otherwise

setValidate

public void setValidate(boolean validate)
Sets the Validate flag. If this flag is true, use the validating parser.

isValidate

public boolean isValidate()
Returns:
true when the validating parser should be used; false when the non-validating parser should be used.

setUsePrettyPrint

public void setUsePrettyPrint(boolean pprint)
Sets the use tidy pprint flag. If this flag is true, use the tidy pretty print.

getUsePrettyPrint

public boolean getUsePrettyPrint()
Returns:
tidy pretty print flag.

handleException

public void handleException(Exception e,
                            boolean throwException)
                     throws PSExtensionProcessingException
Prints exception context to the trace file, and optionally throws a new PSExtensionProcessingException. This standard exception handler should be used at the "main" level of each extension to catch all unexpected exceptions.

Parameters:
e - the exception to log
throwException - flag that if true will cause an exception to be thrown
Throws:
PSExtensionProcessingException - if throwException is true

handleException

public void handleException(Exception e)
                     throws PSExtensionProcessingException
Prints exception context to the trace file and throws a new exception. This standard exception handler should be used at the "main" level of each extension to catch all unexpected exceptions.

Parameters:
e - the exception to log
Throws:
PSExtensionProcessingException - always
